results.title: Big Wednesday
results.creator_credit: John Milius, Buzz Feitshans and A-Team Productions
results.brief_description: Set between 1962 and 1974, “Big Wednesday” is the story of three surfing friends - Matt, Jack and Leroy. We see their loves, fights and the hero worship that follows them as they conquer the waves. The South Swell 1962: the three rule the waves. Together with their friends they get drunk, go on surfing holidays and have wild and destructive parties. As the years pass, the Vietnam War and growing up take their toll. They witness the changes in themselves, their home and friends. The Great Swell 1974: Matt, Jack and Leroy re-unite to brave one last journey together, to surf the great swell. “Big Wednesday” encapsulates the emotions of passing youth against the splendour of the sea and surfing. Includes a special appearance by surfing legend, “Mr. Pipeline”, Jerry Lopez. Cast includes: William Katt, Gary Busey, Jan Michael Vincent, Patti D’Arbanville and Lee Purcell.

results.title: Face/off
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Christopher Goosick, Terence Chang, Barrie M Osborne, David Permut, WCG Entertainment and Douglas Reuter Productions
results.brief_description: Acclaimed Hong Kong action director John Woo has created a delirious mix of spectacular gun battles, furious explosions and breathtaking stunts. John Travolta plays driven but anguished FBI agent Sean Archer, who is using the full force of his anti-terrorist unit to track down the psychotic criminal Castor Troy, energetically played by Nicolas Cage. Thinking he has finally killed Castor in a spectacular airport shootout, Archer is horrified to discover that he is in fact alive but in a coma. Undergoing a radical face-swapping procedure, Archer assumes Castor’s identity in an attempt to discover the Los Angeles location of a nerve gas bomb due to explode. When Castor awakens from his coma, he retaliates by infiltrating the real Archer’s life and destroying any evidence of the identity switch. Archer is thrust into a nightmare, where he must fight for his life and his family. This cat and mouse thriller was written by Mike Werb and Michael Colleary. Music by John Powell. Edited by Christian Wagner and Steven Kemper. Cinematography by Oliver Wood. Also stars Joan Allen, Alessandro Nivola, Gina Gershon, Dominique Swain and Nick Cassavetes.

results.title: Beautiful girls
results.creator_credit: Ted Demme, Cary Woods, Woods Entertainment and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: A ten year high school reunion in a snowbound town is the setting for this exploration of how men’s lives are influenced by “beautiful girls”. Piano playing Willie (Hutton), former heartthrob Tommy (Dillon), his girlfriend Sharon (Sorvino), and his lover Darian (Holly) all gather with long lost friends for reminiscing and advice about relationships. Out of the group of friends, only Willie has moved away from the small New England town and is pursuing a career as a piano player. He is at a crossroads in his life, contemplating giving up his career for girlfriend Tracy (Annabeth Gish). His feelings are complicated by the presence of a captivating young girl next door (Natalie Portman).

results.title: Hard target
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Sean Daniel, James Jacks, Renaissance Productions and Alphaville
results.brief_description: Chance Boudreaux (Jean Claude Van Damme) is a down on his luck Cajun soldier, reluctantly hired by Nat Binder (Yancy Butler) to help find her father, an ex Green Beret who is currently homeless in Louisiana. What they both don’t know is that their mission is doomed to fail, as Nat’s father has been brutally murdered as sport. His killer is the ruthless Fouchon (Lance Henriksen), a mercenary who procures homeless people living around New Orleans and enlists them in his game, whereby they become the live targets. This film features enough of John Woo’s trademark action and Jean Claude Van Damme’s physical presence to satisy Woo and JCVD fans.

results.title: Only you
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Charles Mulvehill, Robert N. Fried, Gary Woods, Tri-Star Pictures, Yorktown Productions Ltd and Fried Woods Films
results.brief_description: This very romantic comedy is all about a girl named Faith (Marisa Tomei) who searches for her “soul mate” named Damon Bradley. She was advised of this name by the Ouija board and a gypsy fortune teller. A week before her wedding, “Damon” phones to say he is unable to attend. Faith believes she must leave her fiancee, travel to Italy, and find her date with destiny”. During her search, the wrong man (Robert Downy Jnr) falls madly in love with her. What is she to do? With breathless scenery and brilliant performances, it’s irresistible entertainment that everyone will enjoy. Cast also includes Billy Zane and Fisher Stevens.

results.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
results.creator_credit: Helen Deutsch, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Debbie Reynolds stars in her Oscar nominated performance as the eponymous Molly Brown. Destined for better things, Western orphan Molly leaves her mountain cabin and her uneducated and poor upbringing in search of a rich husband and a better life in Denver society. In a typical rags to riches fashion, Molly becomes the wealthiest woman in society. Based on the musical play with music and lyrics by Meredith Wilson. Screen play by Helen Deutsch. Cast includes Debbie Reynolds, Harve Presnell and Ed Begley.

results.title: Halloween
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Debra Hill and Falcon Film
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s much imitated ‘Halloween’ defined the eighties stalk and slash genre, spawning inferior copies like the ‘Friday the 13th’ series (including six sequels of it’s own), and for a time making star Jamie Lee Curtis into the premium “scream queen”. Later on the conventions of the genre were cleverly re-invented for a nineties audience by director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson in ‘Scream’, which pays direct homage to ‘Halloween’. John Carpenter opens his film with an unnerving point of view shot of the young psychotic Michael Myers brutally stabbing his teenage sister to death on Halloween night. Flash forward to Halloween 15 years later and Michael has escaped the mental institution he has been locked up in. Meanwhile shy, virginal teenager Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her girlfriends are preparing for Halloween, unaware of the menace that lurks in their quiet suburban community. Carpenter makes great use of the sparse, atmospheric music score (which he also composed), and uses to maximum creepy effect the white mask Michael Myers wears throughout the film. The film also established the classic horror genre rule- if your a sexually active teenager, you die! Cast also includes Donald Pleasence, P.J. Soles, Tony Moran.

results.title: Silk stockings
results.creator_credit: Rouben Mamoulian, Arthur Freed, Arthur Freed Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In this exuberant song and dance remake of Lubitsch’s ‘Ninotchka’, Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse team up as the leading couple. Ninotchka, a stern lady Communist (Charisse) comes to Paris to retrieve three wayward comrades (Peter Lorre, Jules Munshin, Joseph Buloff) and a Russian composer (George Tobias). Much to her surprise, she is seduced by the trappings of capitalism in the form of champagne, silk stockings and a suave American producer (Fred Astaire), all of which contradict her Communist sensibilities. Includes songs such as: “Fated to be mated”, “All of you”, “The Ritz Rock and Roll”, “Silk stockings”, “Red blues”, “Josephine” and “Stereophonic sound”. Music and lyrics by Cole Porter. Screenplay by Leonard Gershe and Leonard Spigelgass.

results.title: Roustabout
results.creator_credit: John Rich, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The year is 1964, and the mini-skirt is in. Charlie Rogers is a coffee-house singer who joins a financially troubled carnival. He is hired by owner, Maggie Morgan, and soon catches the eye of his pretty female co-worker, Cathy Lean. Cathy’s irate father, Joe, clashes with Charlie when he tries to romance his daughter, but Charlie’s singing and looks helps bring in the much-needed money for the near-bankrupt carnival. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman and Leif Erickson.

results.title: Mars attacks!
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Larry Franco and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Science fiction and cult movie fans will warm to Tim Burton’s distinct brand of humour in this sci-fi spoof where, once again, Earth is invaded by martians. These mean green invaders from the Red Planet have slimey humungous brains, are armed with Instr-ray guns, and are cinematically supported by state-of-the-art special effects. The stars that shine here include Jack Nicholson (in a dual role), Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Pierce Brosnan, Danny DeVito, plus many more notable cameos (including one by Tom Jones).
